documentInfo.title: My IDEXHUB Customer Standard Operation Procedure

master.name: Master Data Management
master.description: Core master data configuration for MyIDEX HUB system

sections.title: Region Master
sections.objective: This SOP outlines the steps to manage regions within the MyIDEX HUB platform, including adding, editing, and deleting region entries.
prerequisites: Valid login credentials for accessing the MyIDEX HUB platform
Appropriate permissions to access and modify Region data under the 'Master' module

steps: Navigate to the 'Master' tab on the left navigation menu
Select the 'Region' sub-tab from the top menu
Enter the desired region name in the 'Enter Name' field
Select the currency from the 'Select Currency' dropdown
Click the blue 'Add' button to save the new region

notes: To edit a region, click the pencil (edit) icon under the 'Action' column
To delete a region, click the trash bin icon under the 'Action' column

sections.title: Groups Master
sections.description: This SOP document provides a step-by-step guide for managing Groups in the MyIDEX HUB portal. This includes adding, editing, and deleting Groups associated with various regions.

steps.title: Navigate to Groups Section
details: Login to the MyIDEX HUB portal
From the left-hand menu, click on 'Master'
Select the 'Groups' tab from the top navigation bar

steps.title: Add a New Group
details: Enter the Group Name in the 'Enter Name*' field
Select the appropriate Region from the 'Select Region*' dropdown
Click the 'Add' button to save the group
The newly added group will appear in the list below

steps.title: Edit or Delete a Group
details: Click the edit (pencil) icon next to the group you want to modify
Make the necessary changes and click 'Update'
To delete a group, click the delete (trash bin) icon

notes: Deleting a group is irreversible and should be done with caution

sections.title: Value Streams (BU) Master
sections.objective: This SOP outlines the steps for managing and maintaining Value Streams in the MyIDEX HUB system. Value Streams help categorize and organize business units, their associated margin percentages, and related configuration.
navigation: From the left-hand menu, click on 'Master'
Navigate to the top navigation bar and click on 'Value Stream'

addingValueStream.title: Adding a New Value Stream
steps: Navigate to the Value Streams (BU) Master section from the left menu
Click the 'Add' or '+' button to open the Value Stream creation form
Enter the Value Stream Name in the text field (required)
Enter the Margin % (required) - this represents the profit margin for the value stream
Select the Group from the dropdown menu (required)
Enter or select the Region in the text field (required)
Select the Service Receiver from the dropdown menu (required)
Review all the entered information for accuracy
Click the 'Submit' or 'Save' button to create the new Value Stream entry
The new Value Stream will now appear in the listing with a unique ID

management.edit: Click the pencil icon to edit an entry
management.delete: Click the trash icon to delete an entry

sections.title: Internal Stages Master
sections.description: This SOP outlines the process of managing Internal Stages within the MyIDEX HUB platform

steps.title: Navigate to the Master Section
steps.details: From the left sidebar, click on the 'Master' tab. This section provides various configuration options including Workflow, Template, Pre Defined Fields, and Internal Stage

steps.title: Access Internal Stage Tab
steps.details: Click on the 'Internal Stage' tab at the top of the page. This tab allows users to manage stages that are used in different workflow processes within the system

steps.title: Add a New Internal Stage
substeps: Enter the stage name in the 'Enter Name' field
Click the blue 'Add' button to save the new stage
To cancel the action, click the 'Cancel' button

steps.title: Manage Existing Stages
steps.details: The list below the input field shows all existing internal stages. Each entry includes a serial number, the stage name, and action buttons (Edit and Delete) on the right side. You can click the pencil icon to edit a stage or the trash icon to delete it

sections.title: Payment Term Master
sections.description: Payment Terms define the payment conditions and timelines for customer orders. Simple Payment Terms have fixed credit days, while Milestone Payment Terms link payments to project milestones.

simplePaymentTerm.name: Simple Payment Terms
simplePaymentTerm.description: Fixed payment terms based on credit days from invoice date. Examples include "Net 30" (30 days credit) or "Net 60" (60 days credit).
navigation: Click on the "Simple Payment Terms" tab

steps: Click the "Add" button
Enter Payment Code (e.g., PT30, PT60)
Enter Payment Description (e.g., Net 30 Days)
Enter Credit Days (e.g., 30, 60)
Click "Save" to create the payment term

milestonePaymentTerm.name: Milestone Payment Terms
milestonePaymentTerm.description: Payment terms linked to project milestones. Payments are released upon completion of specific project phases or deliverables.
accessing: Click on the "Milestone Payment Terms" tab

steps: Click the "Add" button
Enter Payment Code (e.g., MPT-PRJ1)
Enter Payment Description
Define milestones with percentage allocations
Ensure total milestone percentage equals 100%
Enter total credit days for final payment
Click "Save" to create the milestone payment term

sections.objective: Understand and manage two types of payment terms: Simple Payment Terms and Milestone Payment Terms in the MyIDEX HUB system
navigation: Click on "Master" from the left navigation menu
Select "Payment Terms" from the menu options

sections.title: 80/20 Product Master
sections.description: This SOP provides steps for managing 80/20 Product data in the MyIDEX HUB platform
sections.accessing: Navigate to the 'Master' section in the left-hand menu and select the '80/20 Product' tab on the top menu

add: In the 'Add 80/20 Product' section, enter the name of the product (e.g., '80' or '20')
Click the 'Add' button to save the new entry
The new entry will appear in the table below with an auto-generated serial number
edit: Click the pencil (edit) icon under the 'Action' column for the entry you wish to update
Modify the name as needed in the text field
Click the 'Update' button to save changes
delete: Click the trash bin icon under the 'Action' column for the respective entry
The entry will be removed from the list

sections.title: 80/20 Customer Master
sections.description: This SOP outlines the procedure to add or manage entries in the 80/20 Customer Master within the MyIDEX HUB portal. The 80/20 classification helps in customer segmentation based on the Pareto principle
steps: Login to the MyIDEX HUB application
Navigate to the 'Master' section from the left sidebar menu
Click on the '80/20 Customer' tab at the top navigation
Use the 'Enter Name' field to input the name or classification (e.g., 20 or 80)
Click on the 'Add' button to save the entry
To edit or delete an existing entry, use the respective icons under the 'Action' column
Use the search bar to find specific entries quickly

sections.title: Application Master
sections.description: This SOP provides steps for managing Application data in the MyIDEX HUB platform

steps.title: Navigate to Application Section
steps.details: From the dashboard, go to the 'Master' section on the left-hand menu. Then select 'Application' from the top navigation bar

steps.title: Add Application
steps.details: To add a new application, enter the application name in the 'Name' field under the 'Add Application' section. Click the blue 'Add' button to save it. Use the 'Cancel' button to discard the action

steps.title: View, Edit, or Delete Application

sections.title: Currency Master
sections.description: This SOP provides step-by-step instructions for managing Currency Master in the MyIDEX HUB application. The Currency Master allows the user to define various currencies with their corresponding symbols and exchange rates against the base currency (INR)
steps: Navigate to the Master section in the left-hand menu
Click on the 'Currency' tab from the top navigation bar

steps.title: To add a new currency
substeps: Enter the currency Name in the 'Name*' field
Enter the corresponding Symbol in the 'Symbol*' field
Enter the Exchange Rate (Base: INR) in the corresponding field
Click the 'Add' button to save the new currency

steps: To edit or delete an existing currency, use the respective icons under the 'Action' column

sections.title: Delayed Reason Master
sections.description: This SOP outlines the process for managing delayed reasons in the MyIDEX HUB platform under the 'Master' section. It describes how to add, edit, and remove delayed reasons that are used to document and track causes for delivery delays
steps: Navigate to the MyIDEX HUB dashboard
From the left sidebar, click on 'Master'
Select 'Delayed Reason' from the top tab bar

steps.title: To add a new reason
substeps: Enter the reason in the input box labeled 'Enter Name*'
Click the 'Add' button to save the new delayed reason

steps: Existing reasons are listed in a table with options to edit or delete each entry
To edit an entry, click the pencil icon under the 'Action' column
To delete an entry, click the trash bin icon under the 'Action' column

sections.title: Document List Master
sections.description: This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) outlines the steps to manage the Document List in the MyIDEX HUB platform.
steps: Log into the MyIDEX HUB platform.
From the left-hand side menu, navigate to 'Master'.

Click the 'Add' button to save the document.
To cancel the operation, click the 'Cancel' button.

sections.title: Freight Scope Master

managing.edit: Click the pencil (edit) icon under the 'Action' column to edit an existing Freight Scope.
managing.delete: Click the trash bin icon under the 'Action' column to delete a Freight Scope.
managing.search: Use the search bar to filter freight scopes by name quickly.

sections.title: Industry/Segment Master
sections.description: This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) outlines the steps to manage Industry/Segment data in the MyIDEX HUB platform. This includes adding new Industry/Segment entries and viewing or editing existing ones under the 'Master' section.
steps: Navigate to the 'Master' section in the left menu.
Click on the 'Industry/Segment' tab from the top menu.

steps.title: To add a new Industry/Segment
substeps: Click on 'Add Industry/Segment' button.
Enter the industry/segment name in the text box.
Click 'Add' to save the new entry or 'Cancel' to discard.

steps: To search for an existing Industry/Segment, use the search bar.
To edit or delete an existing entry, use the respective action icons under the 'Action' column.

sections.title: Insurance Scope Master
sections.purpose: This SOP outlines the steps required to manage the Insurance Scope section in the MyIDEX HUB system. It includes instructions for viewing, adding, editing, and deleting entries under the Insurance Scope.
sections.scope: This SOP is applicable to all users who are responsible for maintaining insurance-related data within the MyIDEX HUB platform.
procedure: Navigate to the 'Master' section in the left-side menu.
Click on the 'Insurance Scope' tab in the top navigation bar.
View the list of existing Insurance Scopes.

procedure.title: To add a new Insurance Scope
substeps: Enter the name in the 'Enter Name' field.

sections.title: KPI Settings in MyIDEX HUB
sections.description: This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) provides steps for managing KPI Settings data in the MyIDEX HUB platform. It includes the process for adding, editing, and deleting entries in the KPI Settings section.

navigate.title: Step 1: Navigate to KPI Settings
substeps: Log in to the MyIDEX HUB application.
From the left-hand sidebar, click on 'KPI Setting' to view the KPI records.

add.title: Step 2: Add KPI Setting
substeps: Click on the 'Add KPI Setting' button located at the top-right.
Fill in the required fields such as BU, Year, Annual Sale, Margins, etc.
Enter monthly data for Sales, Margin %, Order Inflow, etc.
Click the 'Add' button to save the data.

edit.title: Step 3: Edit KPI Setting
substeps: Locate the KPI entry you want to edit in the list.
Click the pencil/edit icon under the 'Action' column.
Update the necessary information in the form.
Click the 'Update' or 'Save' button to apply the changes.

delete.title: Step 4: Delete KPI Setting
substeps: Locate the KPI entry you wish to delete.
Click the trash/delete icon under the 'Action' column.
Confirm the deletion when prompted.
The KPI entry will be permanently removed from the list.

notes: Only one KPI Setting can be added per BU for a particular year.

sections.title: LD Clause Master
sections.purpose: The purpose of this Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is to provide clear instructions for managing the LD (Liquidated Damages) Clauses within the MyIDEX HUB platform. This includes adding, editing, and deleting LD Clauses.
sections.scope: This procedure applies to all users with access rights to modify the Master section under the LD Clauses tab in the MyIDEX HUB system.
sections.responsibilities: It is the responsibility of the authorized personnel to ensure that accurate LD Clauses are maintained within the system.
procedure: Log in to the MyIDEX HUB platform.
Navigate to the 'Master' section from the left-hand menu.
Click on the 'LD Clauses' tab at the top.
To add a new clause, enter the name of the LD Clause in the 'Add LD Clauses' section and click 'Add'.
To edit an existing entry, click the pencil icon under the 'Action' column.
To delete an entry, click the trash icon under the 'Action' column.
notes: Ensure that all data entered is accurate and up to date. Deleting or editing clauses should be done with caution as it affects compliance tracking.

sections.title: Inco Terms Master
sections.description: This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) outlines the steps to view, add, edit, and delete Inco Terms in the MyIDEX HUB platform.

steps.title: Access the Inco Terms Section
steps.details: Navigate to the 'Master' section on the left-hand panel, then select 'Inco Terms' from the tab options at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Add a New Inco Term
substeps: Enter the name of the Inco Term in the 'Enter Name' field.
Select the type from the dropdown (e.g., import).
Enter a description in the 'Enter Description' field.
Click on the 'Add' button to save the new Inco Term.

steps.title: Edit or Delete Existing Inco Terms
steps.details: In the list of existing Inco Terms, use the pencil icon under the 'Action' column to edit a term, or the trash bin icon to delete it.

sections.title: Nature of Component Interface

sections.title: Plant Location Master

steps.title: Step 2: Add a New Plant Location

steps.title: Step 3: View or Manage Existing Locations

sections.title: TPI Agency Master
sections.description: This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) provides a step-by-step guide for managing the 'TPI Agency' section in the MyIDEX HUB system. This module is used to maintain Third-Party Inspection (TPI) agencies that are associated with various service or product quality checks.
stepsToAdd: Navigate to the 'Master' section in the left menu.

Click on the blue 'Add' button to save the new agency.

sections.title: Zone Master
sections.description: This document outlines the steps to manage zones in the MyIDEX HUB system under the 'Master' module.

accessing.title: Accessing the Zone Section
steps: Navigate to the 'Master' tab in the left-hand menu.
Click on the 'Zone' tab from the top navigation bar.

adding.title: Adding a New Zone

managing.title: Managing Existing Zones

sections.title: Role Master
sections.objective: This SOP outlines the procedure for managing user roles within the MyIDEX HUB platform, including adding, editing, and deleting roles.
prerequisites: Valid login credentials for accessing the MyIDEX HUB platform.
Appropriate permissions to access and modify Role data under the 'Master' module.
procedure: Navigate to the 'Master' tab on the left navigation menu.
Select the 'Roles' sub-tab from the top menu.
Enter the desired role name in the 'Enter Role Name' field.
Choose the role type (Internal/External) from the 'Select Type' dropdown.
Click the blue 'Add' button to save the new role.
notes: To edit a role, click the pencil (edit) icon under the 'Action' column.
To delete a role, click the trash bin icon under the 'Action' column.
You can assign permissions of different Master modules to roles by clicking the user icon in the 'Action' column.

rolePermissionMapping.description: Once a role is created, permissions for different modules and functionalities can be assigned by clicking the user icon under the 'Action' column.
steps: Each row represents a module or feature in the system.
Use the toggle switches under Read, Create, Update, and Delete columns to enable or disable specific permissions for the role.
You can use 'Select All Permissions' or 'Select All Master' options to bulk assign permissions.
Changes are saved after clicking on the Save button and particular permissions are assigned to the specific Role.

sections.title: Pre Defined Field Master
sections.description: This SOP outlines the steps to add a Pre Defined Field in the MyIDEX HUB platform. The feature is found under the 'Master' section of the application and is used to manage custom fields that can be utilized across various modules.
steps: Navigate to the 'Master' menu from the left-side panel.
Click on the 'Pre Defined Field' tab located in the top navigation bar.
Use the input section titled 'Add Pre Defined Field' to add new entries.

steps.title: Fill in the following details
substeps: Enter Label – The name for the new field.
Select Field Type – Choose the type (e.g., textarea, number, checkbox, etc.).
Select Data Type – Choose the data type this field is associated with (Custom Form, OI Filter, Template).
Optionally, choose the Grouping Type if applicable (SO fields, OI form, etc.).

steps: Click the blue 'Add' button to save the new field.
The new entry will be listed in the table below once successfully added.
To edit an existing entry, click the pencil (edit) icon under the 'Action' column.
To delete an entry, click the trash (delete) icon under the 'Action' column.
notes: Case 1: When Data Type 'Custom Forms' is selected, the predefined field will appear in Custom Forms Master.
Case 2: When Data Type 'Templates' is selected, the predefined field will appear in Template Master.

sections.title: Template Master
sections.description: This SOP outlines the steps to manage email templates in the MyIDEX HUB platform under the Master section.

steps.title: Navigate to Template Section
steps.details: Login to MyIDEX HUB and from the left side menu, click on 'Master'. Then select 'Template' under the 'Master' section to view the list of existing templates.

steps.title: Add New Template
steps.details: Click on the 'Add Template' button on the top right corner to create a new template.

steps.title: Fill Template Details
steps.details: Enter the Name and Subject of the template and select Applicable BU from the dropdown list.

steps.title: Predefined Field Master Reference
steps.details: The left panel shows the fields which are maintained under 'Pre Defined Field'. These fields are used as placeholders and can be dragged and dropped into the template editor.
steps.note: These placeholders are replaced by the actual value related to the Order.

steps.title: Edit or Delete Template
steps.details: To edit a template, click the pencil (edit) icon next to the respective template row. To delete a template, click the trash (delete) icon. Only authorized users can perform these actions.

sections.title: Custom Form Master
sections.description: This SOP provides detailed instructions for creating a custom form. Following these steps ensures consistency and efficiency in form development.
sections.navigation: Login to MyIDEX HUB and from the left side menu, click on 'Master'. Under the 'Master' section click on the Custom forms.

steps.title: Insert a Panel
substeps: Open the Custom Form Master under Masters tab.
Navigate to the Layout tab on the left panel.
Drag and drop a Panel component into the form workspace.

steps.title: Insert Input Controls
forMultipleInputFields: Drag and drop a Columns component into the panel.
Set the number of divisions (columns) as per the requirement.
Adjust the width of each column (e.g., 6-6 for two equal columns, 4-4-4 for three equal columns).
Drag and drop the required input fields (Text Field, Number, Select, etc.) into the respective columns.
fieldConfiguration: Key: Do not make any changes to the key.
Validation: Define required rules (mandatory, min/max length, etc.).
forSingleInputField: Even if inserting only one input field, first insert a Columns component.
Set the column width to 12 to span the entire form width.
Drag and drop the desired input field into the column.
Configure the input field as needed (label, key, validation, etc.).
Click Save to apply the settings.

steps.title: Insert Buttons
substeps: Navigate to the Basic tab in the left panel.
Drag and drop a Button component directly into the panel (with or without a column container).

steps.title: Save and Test the Form
substeps: Click the Save Form button to store all changes.
Preview the form by clicking the Preview button.

sections.title: WorkFlow Master
sections.description: This Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) provides steps for managing workflow data in the MyIDEX HUB platform. It includes the process for adding, editing, and deleting entries in the workflow section under the Master module.
sections.navigation: Login to MyIDEX HUB and from the left side menu, click on 'Master'. Then select 'Workflow' under the 'Master' section to view the list of existing workflows.

workflowListingPage.description: This section allows users to view and manage existing workflows. Users can search workflows, add new workflows, and edit or delete existing ones.

workflowFormPage.description: This section is used for creating or updating workflow details including associated business unit (multiple), reference workflow, and defining activity steps.

fields.workflowReference: Represents taking another workflow as a reference.
fields.forwardAndBackwardDependency: Check box enables both dependency columns in the activities section.

activities.internalStage: Internal Stage dropdown is populated from the Internal Stage master.
activities.actionBy: Action By dropdown is populated from the Role master.
activities.activityName: Activity Name is an input field where users enter the activity name.
activities.targetDays: Target Days indicates the number of days required to complete the activity.
activities.forwardDependency: Forward Dependency defines which activity should follow the current one.
activities.backwardDependency: Backward Dependency is used to calculate the target date of the selected activity in a bottom-to-top flow.
activities.backwardDateCheck: Represents from which activity the backward calculation should start.

notificationSections.description: There are three notification sections: Internal, Customer, and Distributor.

customer.description: Includes internal users and all three types of contact persons from the Customer Master.

distributor.description: Includes internal users and distributor names.

commonFields.description: All three sections contain two common fields.
fields: Document List (fetched from Document List Master)
commonFields.purpose: Used to define which users will receive a specific email when a particular activity is completed, along with the selected email template and documents.

applicableFormList.purpose: Used to specify which form is selected for a particular activity stage in Orders.

tabName.description: Represents the name of the tab for a specific activity. This tab name is displayed when an order is created.

activitySymbols.plus: Used to add a new activity to the workflow.
activitySymbols.minus: Used to remove an activity from the workflow.

buttons.yellowButton: Located in the top right corner. Used to preview the flowchart of the workflow.
buttons.greenButton: Located in the top right corner. Used to download all workflow data in Excel format.

sections.title: User Management
sections.description: This SOP outlines the standard operating procedure for managing users in the MyIDEX HUB system. It includes steps for listing users, adding new users, and understanding the functionality of each icon present in the user interface
sections.note: Internal and Distributor users are created from the same 'Add User' page. The user is categorized based on the selected role — if the role is 'Distributor', the user appears in the Distributor listing page; otherwise, the user is listed under Internal users

listingPage.title: User Listing Page
listingPage.description: The user listing page provides a comprehensive overview of all internal users

icons.name: Lock icon
icons.description: Indicates whether a user is active or inactive

icons.name: Email box icon
icons.description: Used to resend the registration mail to the user

icons.name: User icon
icons.description: Opens the permission settings for the selected user

icons.name: Arrow icon
icons.description: Used to transfer assets to another user

icons.name: Edit icon
icons.description: Allows editing of the existing user's information

icons.name: Delete icon
icons.description: Deletes the user from the system

addUserPage.title: Add User Page
addUserPage.note: The dropdowns for 'Role', 'Region', 'Group', and 'User Value Stream' are dynamically populated from their respective master lists

rules: All groups and Business Units (BUs) are automatically selected
The user can only select the region

adminL2FromL1.description: When creating Admin L2 from Admin L1
rules: The region and groups can be selected by the user
All Business Units (BUs) are selected by default

adminL3FromL1.description: When creating Admin L3 from Admin L1
rules: The region, groups, and BUs will be selected by user

adminL3FromL2.description: When creating Admin L3 from Admin L2
rules: The region is selected by default
Groups and Business Units (BUs) are selected by user

anyUserFromL3.description: When any user is created by Admin L3
rules: The region and groups are automatically selected
BUs will be selected by the user

addUserPage.postCreation: After a user is created, the system sends an email to the user's registered email address. The email contains a user registration link. By clicking this link, the user can set their password via OTP verification

customerUserSection.title: Customer User Section
customerUserSection.description: Customer users are fetched from the Customer Master. Each customer entry in the system includes three types of contact persons

orders.name: Order Management
orders.description: Order creation, tracking, and workflow management

sections.title: Order Creation & Listing
sections.description: This SOP provides steps for managing Orders data in the MyIDEX HUB platform

orderListingPage.description: The Order Listing Page displays all existing orders with customizable columns
features: The gear (settings) icon allows the user to customize the visible columns on the order listing page
Columns such as OMS Order ID, OI Date, Sales Representative, BU/Value Stream, Status, and Current Order Stage can be selected or deselected
Click on the Add order Button for new order creation

fields.name: Sales Representative
fields.description: Indicates the person who created the order. Typically, this should be a user with the sales role

fields.name: VSM/BU
fields.description: Displays all value streams. It specifies the Business Unit under which the order is created

fields.name: Workflow
fields.description: Shows all workflows associated with the selected BU

fields.name: Distributor Name
fields.description: Shows only users with the 'Distributor' role under the selected BU

flowchart.description: A flowchart is a visual diagram that represents the sequence of steps or activities in a process

statuses.name: Hold
statuses.description: Indicates that the order is currently on hold. All In Progress activities are highlighted in red

statuses.name: Pending
statuses.description: Indicates that the activities are yet to begin

statuses.name: In Progress
statuses.description: Indicates that activities are currently ongoing

statuses.name: Delayed In Progress
statuses.description: Indicates that the activity has passed its estimated completion date

statuses.name: Completed
statuses.description: Indicates that the activity is fully completed

statuses.name: Skipped
statuses.description: Indicates that the activity was skipped due to certain reasons

statuses.name: Partially Completed
statuses.description: Indicates that the activity has been partially submitted

features: PDF icon on top right corner for download flowchart in pdf format

activityStage.description: Order's Activity Stage section displays the OMS ID and different activity tabs
features: OMS ID is displayed in the top-left corner after the first activity submission
Top slide bar displays Tab names of all activities with their current status
Each Tab represents a different activity stage configured in Custom Form Master

buttons.name: Save Data
buttons.description: Used to save the currently filled data without submitting

buttons.name: Skip Activity
buttons.description: Used to skip the current activity and move to the next one

buttons.name: Partial Submit
buttons.description: Used to partially submit the activity when not fully completed

buttons.name: Submit Without External Notification
buttons.description: Submit activity without sending notifications to external users; only internal team members receive notification

buttons.name: Final Submit
buttons.description: Final submission of the activity once all required information is completed

actions.name: Send for Approval
actions.description: Used when margin before order execution is less than required margin set by BLD person. Sends approval email to BLD person
actions.workflow: BLD person reviews and approves the margin

actions.name: Scope Change
actions.description: Used to revert the workflow back to first activity
actions.workflow: System resets all following activities, setting first one to In-Progress but keeps all data saved. Email notification sent to all internal stakeholders

actions.name: Order Detail Update
actions.description: Used to update details of an already submitted activity
actions.workflow: Sends email to all internal users involved in the order

actions.name: Project Hold
actions.description: Used to pause or hold the order for any reason
actions.workflow: Triggers email notification to all internal users

actions.name: Project Hold Release
actions.description: Used to resume a project that was previously on hold
actions.workflow: Order continues from where it was paused. Sends email notification to all internal stakeholders

actions.name: Reject Activity
actions.description: Used when a mistake is found in a previously submitted activity
actions.workflow: Activity is rejected with reason. Responsible user receives email about rejection

actions.name: Partial Submit - Completed
actions.description: Used when a partially submitted activity is now fully completed
actions.workflow: Marks the activity as fully submitted

actions.name: Delivered Status
actions.description: Used after dispatch to confirm delivery
actions.workflow: Displays all dispatched line items, including fields for date and attachments

financialGraph.title: Financial Graph
financialGraph.description: Provides a visual representation of various sales and order-related metrics
financialGraph.dataDisplay: Displays monthly data across the selected year

performanceGraph.title: Performance Graph
performanceGraph.description: Shows activity performance based on workflow progress

sections.title: Customer Dashboard
sections.description: This dashboard provides customer-specific order tracking and service request management

customerSelection.description: Select a specific customer to view their data

activeOrders.description: Displays the number of ongoing orders for the selected customer

pastOrders.description: Displays the number of completed orders for the selected customer

pendingActions.description: Indicates the number of payment reminders sent to the customer

openRequests.description: Shows the count of service requests raised against the selected customer
openRequests.action: If no open requests, a new service request can be created by clicking 'Create New'

recentOrders.description: Displays a table of customer's recent orders

orderListing.description: Opens a complete list of all orders for the selected customer

recentOrderStatus.description: Shows the status of most recent order using visual order tracker

orderTrackerStages.name: Order Initiated
orderTrackerStages.trigger: When first submission is made by sales team, generating OMS-ID

orderTrackerStages.name: Order Acknowledged
orderTrackerStages.trigger: When next status for all line items from SO is >= 536 for respective OMS-ID

orderTrackerStages.name: Engineering & Procurement
orderTrackerStages.trigger: When next status is >= 532 and 'OMS Engineering Completed' button is activated

orderTrackerStages.name: Manufacturing
orderTrackerStages.trigger: When next status for all line items from SO is >= 540

orderTrackerStages.name: Dispatched
orderTrackerStages.trigger: When next status for all line items from SO is >= 600

orderTrackerStages.name: Delivered
orderTrackerStages.trigger: Final stage manually updated by dispatch team

fields: PO Date - Date of the Purchase Order
IDEX SO No - IDEX Sales Order Number
IDEX SO Date - Date the Sales Order was created
Requested Date - Delivery date requested by customer
Payment Terms - Terms of payment (e.g., FI)

pendingActions.description: Displays number of payment reminders sent for this order

viewDocument.description: Opens list of documents attached under Required Document List for the specific order

sections.title: Executive Dashboard
sections.description: High-level executive view of key business metrics and performance indicators

keyComponents.monthsDetermination: Based on the OMS ID generation month
keyComponents.dataFiltering: Displayed based on the selected Business Unit (BU)
keyComponents.currencyConversion: Data is converted according to the selected currency

metrics.name: Forecasted Sales Margin
metrics.source: KPI input of Sales forecast margin

metrics.name: Actual Sales
metrics.calculation: Addition of ExtPrice of all order line no from JDE

metrics.name: Forecasted Order Inflow
metrics.source: KPI inputs of order inflow forecast

metrics.name: Forecasted Order Inflow Margin
metrics.source: KPI inputs of order inflow margin

metrics.name: Actual Order Inflow
metrics.calculation: Addition of ExtPrice of Order line no if order exists in JDE else Addition of Customer PO value from IDEX portal

metrics.name: Order Booked in JDE
metrics.calculation: Addition of ExtPrices of all orders whose Sales order No. is generated (Exist in JDE)

metrics.name: Engineering
metrics.calculation: Addition of Customer PO value of orders whose current stage is Engineering (Decided by Action by ID)

metrics.name: Application
metrics.calculation: Addition of Customer PO value of orders whose current stage is Application (Decided by Action by ID)

metrics.name: CSR
metrics.calculation: Addition of Customer PO value of orders whose current stage is CSR (Decided by Action by ID)

tiles.name: Functional OTD %
tiles.formula: (Completed within target days / Total number of completed stages) * 100

tiles.name: Functional Lead Days
tiles.formula: (Summation of all Stage's actual days / Total no. stages) * 100

tiles.name: Functional % Accuracy
tiles.description: Percentage of those order stages which are not rejected
tiles.example: 5 are rejected out of 10 orders then 50%

tiles.name: Total Order Book Days
tiles.description: Difference between the OMS ID generation date and sales order generation date

service.name: Service Requests
service.description: Customer service request management and tracking

sections.title: Service Request Module
sections.description: This SOP provides steps for managing Service Request data in the MyIDEX HUB platform

serviceRequestsListing.description: Lists all service requests along with their statuses and associated customer PO numbers
actions: Click Add service button to open service request form
Click pencil icon or trash icon to edit or delete existing service request
Click middle icon between edit/delete to generate CAPA report

customerServiceRequestForm.description: First form under Service Request module, used to log service requests from customers

fields.name: Customer Name
fields.description: Select the customer for whom the service request is being generated

fields.name: Contact Person Details
fields.description: Fill in contact person's details for the respective customer

fields.name: Logged-in User Details
fields.description: Auto-filled with currently logged-in user information

fields.name: Customer PO Number
fields.description: Displays all purchase order numbers associated with selected customer

fields.name: Failure Description
fields.description: Manually input failure description

fields.name: Application of Product
fields.description: Manually input application in which product is used

internalTeamForm.description: Filled by service receiver person of respective Business Unit (BU) associated with order

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: Enter serial number of the product

fields.name: Tag Number
fields.description: Enter tag number related to the product

fields.name: Expectation
fields.description: Define expectation for service request resolution

fields.name: Severity
fields.description: Choose severity level of the issue

fields.name: Expected Closure Date
fields.description: Select expected date of service request closure

fields.name: Forward Request To
fields.description: Select person (based on role) who will receive email notification when form is submitted

closureReportForm.description: Final form to close the service request

fields.name: Schedule a call / Need visit
fields.description: Select appropriate option for follow-up action

fields.name: Expected date of call
fields.description: Select date when call or visit is expected

fields.name: Observation
fields.description: Enter relevant observations made during service or site visit

fields.name: Closure Remark
fields.description: Provide final remarks or summary regarding resolution

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Enter name of person completing closure report

actions.name: Generate & Download
actions.description: Generate and download report of closure request

closureReportForm.note: When service request is closed, closure report will be attached to email and sent to all service-related persons
